programme.desc: Some of the most interesting adaptations in the animal world are completely invisible. Study these hidden, internal alterations to see how different animals have evolved to survive in amazing and unseen ways.(n)

programme.desc: An Australian family go on an adventure to restore an old hunting ranch in South Africa. Their goal is to rebuild the overgrown habitat, create an eco-tourism ranch, and allow the natural wildlife, including predators, to move back in.(n)

programme.title: Kingdom of the Tide
programme.desc: Low tide exposes a band of shore called the intertidal zone. It’s a place of stunning extremes, attacked by hurricane force waves and exposed to baking heat. Creatures here have evolved in countless bizarre ways. Scientists explore this alien realm.(n)

programme.title: Wild Pacific Rescue 1 - Baby Sea Otter Finds a Family
programme.desc: Join the vet and his team in saving a massive sea lion caught in a plastic noose, and then visit the Rescue Center, where a harbor seal pup may lose its eyesight and a baby sea otter needs a risky but life-saving surgery.(n)

programme.title: Arabian Inferno 1 - When the Rain Comes
programme.desc: The Arabian landscape is a virtually waterless desert where rain scarcely falls and animals endure blistering temperatures. But for 3 months every year, a remote region on the south west coast undergoes an astonishing transformation… into a lush, verdant.(n)

programme.title: Mysteries of Evolution 1 - Interior
programme.desc: Some of the most interesting adaptations in the animal world are completely invisible. Study these hidden, internal alterations to see how different animals have evolved to survive in amazing and unseen ways.(n)

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue 1 - The Great Escape
programme.desc: Watch as the Lilongwe Wildlife team try to release two serval cats into the wild. One escapes and returns injured. Will their release be successful? A new baby vervet arrives in critical condition, and a giant owl flies to freedom.(n)

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue 1 - Big Buck Chase
programme.desc: Join Amanda on a white knuckle bush-whacking adventure to rescue a waterbuck caught by a poacher's snare. Meanwhile, the center's resident hyena is treated for flea bitten ears and Alma gets a mysterious late night monkey delivery.(n)

programme.title: Wild Tales from the Farm 1 - Hunkering Down
programme.desc: Winter is coming, and the animals take advantage of autumn’s final bounty before the cold, barren months ahead. Watch some creatures search for respite indoors, while others arrive from far northern climates to settle in the ploughed fields.(n)

programme.title: Supersenses 1 - Invisible World
programme.desc: Dive into a dazzling world beyond human perception, where animals use their super senses to detect light we can’t see, sound we can’t hear and even stranger forces we can’t begin to detect.(n)

programme.title: Pridelands: Wilderness Reborn
programme.desc: An Australian family go on an adventure to restore an old hunting ranch in South Africa. Their goal is to rebuild the overgrown habitat, create an eco-tourism ranch, and allow the natural wildlife, including predators, to move back in.(n)

programme.title: Kingdom of the Tide
programme.desc: Low tide exposes a band of shore called the intertidal zone. It’s a place of stunning extremes, attacked by hurricane force waves and exposed to baking heat. Creatures here have evolved in countless bizarre ways. Scientists explore this alien realm.(n)

programme.title: Mysteries of Evolution 1 - Eyes
programme.desc: Why do zebras have stripes? How do penguins see underwater? And why are a tree frog’s eyes red? In this exploration of sight, discover how some animals have evolved to see extremely well while others have evolved to be nearly invisible.(n)

programme.title: Mysteries of Evolution 1 - Social Animals
programme.desc: Cooperation comes in many forms. Some animals cooperate to be social while others put the welfare of the group above their own reproductive potential. See the many ways species have evolved to work with one another in order to survive.(n)

programme.title: Valley of Flood and Fire 1 - Dying for Rain
programme.desc: South Luangwa National Park is one of Africa’s great wild places. Lying at the southern tip of Africa’s Great Rift Valley, its extraordinary mosaic of habitats supports a rich diversity of life. The fortune of every animal that lives here is inextricably.(n)

programme.title: Brazil Untamed 1 - Monkey Garden
programme.desc: At the southern edge of the Pantanal, the world’s largest tropical wetland on Earth, there’s a placelike no other, and a wildlife so diverse scientists scramble to understand the variety of ways animals interact with each other. The highlands of the Bodoq.(n)

programme.title: Brazil Untamed 1 - Bird Paradise
programme.desc: Every year, the southern wetlands of the Pantanal become a bird paradise as over 650 species of rare and iconic birds congregate here for the breeding season.(n)

programme.title: Brazil Untamed 1 - Peccary Party
programme.desc: In the heart of the Pantanal wetlands, there’s a region so remote very few humans ever get there.The lack of human interaction makes this the perfect habitat for a thunderous herd of three hundred white-lipped peccaries. These large pig-like mammals grow.(n)

programme.title: Uptown Otters 1 - Home Away from Home
programme.desc: Swim upriver with the Bay Family, where Anna offers a hand raising her grandpups before heading home to find interlopers on her turf. Watch a flood in the mangroves nearly sweep away a baby, and see the Townies eat clean through their resources.(n)

programme.title: Uptown Otters 1 - A Busy Bay
programme.desc: Get ready to rumble in Marina Bay, where the Nomads and Townies are squatting while Anna and the Bay Family are away upriver. Soak up the peaceful otter life in this luxurious waterway before the surprise early return of its rightful owners.(n)

programme.title: Uptown Otters 1 - Three's a Crowd
programme.desc: Welcome Anna’s clan back to Marina Bay, where two otter families have been trespassing. Feel the heat when Mia catches Anna’s scent and hustles the Townies out of reach. Then hold tight as the Nomads remain blissfully unaware of the coming conflict.(n)

programme.title: Uptown Otters 1 - Battle for the Bay
programme.desc: Follow the Bay Family’s matriarch as she chases the Nomads out of her territory for good, and examine the surprising birthing den where the Townies’ leader, Mia, settles in. Then kick back with the Mangrove Family as they pal around with stray dogs.(n)

programme.title: Life's Journey 1 - Life Begins
programme.desc: For the first few weeks of life, the world is a frightening place. Danger lurks around every corner. It pays to be alert. Whether predator or prey. Any day might be your last. The race is on to grow up fast- for even the largest animals are vulnerable to.(n)

programme.title: Life's Journey 1 - Life's Lessons
programme.desc: If young animals survive until adulthood, the chances for survival are greatly increased - but many challenges face them before they can strike out on their own. Some have months to grow-up; other have decades – but all, have lots to learn along the way.(n)

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year 1 - Summer
programme.desc: Summer in Africa is a season of extremes, it separates the weak from the strong. It tests the survival instincts of cheetahs, lions, geckos, turtles and many more species as they search for food and water in the extreme heat of summer.(n)

programme.title: Mysteries of Evolution 1 - Ancient Lineages
programme.desc: Some call them “living fossils”, but that's just another way to say survivors. From the shark to the horseshoe crab, these animals' early adaptations were a success, leaving them relatively unchanged for millions of years.(n)

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries 1 - Africa Titans
programme.desc: The death of a wild black rhino after a fight with another dominant male, and a 14-year-old blind black rhino becomes the new ambassador for the species.(n)

programme.title: The Eternal Farm Villages 2 - Koonotori Returns Home Toyooka, Japan
programme.desc: Journey to Hyogo Prefecture, where farmers, conservationists, and civil officials have united to save the Oriental stork from the effects of unrestrained economic development. Witness the success of a 30-year campaign to protect this endangered bird.(n)

programme.title: Brazil Untamed 1 - Jaguar Den
programme.desc: In the heart of Brazil, the largest cat in the Americas, the magnificent jaguar, reigns over a magical land filled with natural beauty and diversity.(n)

programme.title: Brazil Untamed 1 - Cat Country
programme.desc: In many countries the vulnerable and elusive ocelot is on the Endangered Species List. But on the southern edge of the Pantanal, one of the world’s largest tropical wetlands, this magnificent wild cat seems to be making a comeback. A team of young wildlif.(n)

programme.title: Brazil Untamed 1 - Amazon Monkeys
programme.desc: In a protected forest on the southern edge of Brazil’s Amazon Rainforest, lives one of the most intelligent and agile monkeys of the New World - the white-whiskered spider monkey. Their long tails are like a 5th limb and they rarely leave the treetops for.(n)

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild 1 - Chinga the Lion Cub
programme.desc: In South Africa’s Greater Kruger Park, A little cub called Chiga has been born into family of hunters - the Mala Mala lion pride. Under the guidance of a devoted father, a fierce mother, and a playful sister, Chiga finds her place in the pride.(n)

programme.title: New Kids in the Wild 1 - Usana the Cheetah Cub
programme.desc: Usana, a cheetah cub is born with the odds stacked against her. Few cheetah cubs make it through their first year. Lucky for her, she’s got an amazing mother who will stop at nothing to keep her cubs safe. Usana might just follow in her footsteps.(n)

programme.title: In for the Kill
programme.desc: It’s one of the most dramatic events in the natural world. When a predator goes In For the Kill prey scatters, dust flies, and claws and teeth draw red. But how do nature’s killing machines pull off these epic feats of speed, cunning and agility? Some use.(n)

programme.title: Stormborn 1 - Out of the Darkness
programme.desc: Winter releases her iron grip. In Iceland Arctic foxes scurry across mountains to mate. In Shetland an otter raises her cubs. In Norway a vast reindeer herd descends to the calving grounds. A huge March storm rages across the Stormborn lands.(n)

programme.title: Stormborn 1 - Return of the Light
programme.desc: Arctic foxes raise cubs on Iceland’s volcanic shores. Finding food proves challenging until one fox learns to hunt new prey. In Shetland the otter cub strikes out alone and his mother finds a new mate. In Norway reindeer calves take their first steps.(n)

programme.title: Stormborn 1 - Children of the Storm
programme.desc: In Iceland only one out of six cubs has survived. Abandoned by her parents, she now has to fend for herself. The reindeer herd swim two miles across open water. In Scotland, 35,000 grey seals arrive for their annual breeding season.(n)

programme.title: FIFA World Cup 2022 Daily World Cup Show
programme.desc: World Cup Daily will be presented by Claudio Fabiano, and feature Kat Sasso, Warick Beynon, Katalina Haddad, Adamo De Nigris, and Daniel Olaniran, with expert reporters embedded in Qatar, and around the globe. programme.title: 24 Hours in Emergency

programme.title: Zelenskyy: The Story
programme.desc: He is the face of Ukraine's resistance against Putin's invading forces and he is determined to fight. But Volodymyr Zelenskyy was catapulted into power with little traditional political experience. From his beginnings as a TV show actor to his spectacular campaign, his election and his rivalry with Russia's president, here's the story of an incredible journey and an undisputed hero.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are? Aus
programme.desc: Setting out to discover if a mysterious Spanish governess actually existed in her mum's family, Chris Bath finds instead an adventurer with an entrepreneurial spirit who wasn't afraid to tread his own path. Chris ventures into country New South Wales and is shocked to discover she has German ancestry. Uncovering the life of her German ancestors, Chris finds solidarity in their mutual love of the land and is deeply moved by the tragic fate of her three-times great-grandfather.(n)

programme.title: Norfolk Island With Ray Martin
programme.desc: This documentary follows world-famous landscape photographer Ken Duncan and renowned journalist, TV presenter, and avid photographer Ray Martin as they venture into one of the world's wildest and isolated coastlines.(n)

programme.title: Inside Air Force One
programme.desc: Air Force One carries the US president to the frontline of world events. This documentary charts the history of presidential flight and meets those on board with a window seat on history. The assassination of JFK, a flying fortress for the president through 9/11 and perilous flights into war zones: this is the inside story of the 'White House in the Sky'.(n)

programme.title: The Toys That Built The World
programme.desc: As the post-war baby boom creates unprecedented demand for toys, Ruth Handler turns her greatest gamble into the most recognisable toy in the world. Meanwhile, rival Merrill Hassenfeld, at the reigns of a company that will one day be one the most famous brands in the world, tries to capitalise on Handler's success to launch a military doll for boys, which is brilliantly rebranded as the world's first 'action figure', and eventually spawns a television series and a movie franchise. For decades, these two companies battle each other to dominate the toy industry. But when the cultural landscape shifts, they are forced to make desperate choices that ultimately earn their toys immortal status.(n)

programme.title: The Airport: Back in the Skies
programme.desc: It's mid-October and after 18 months of travel restrictions, Jeremy Spake arrives in Heathrow to find the airport decimated by COVID-19 with terminals empty, shops closed, and staff returning from furlough. As India resumes quarantine-free flights, Jeremy helps Virgin turnaround officer Claire as she prepares a Boeing 787 900 for Delhi. On board, Jeremy helps deep clean the aircraft before joining the flight team at the gate to hand out PPE and help calm the nerves of frazzled passengers struggling with passenger locator forms.(n)

programme.title: Tokyo Vice

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Little Heroes
programme.desc: Paul meets GOSH nurse Ruth, who finds herself in the unusual position of having her own baby, 14-week-old Ezra, admitted here. Paul is smitten by Ezra, who has tracheoesophageal fistula - a rare congenital condition that means he has trouble swallowing food. Paul is on hand to support her as her baby boy has surgery to separate his food and wind pipes.(n)

programme.title: The Shape of History
programme.desc: Renowned for his iconic and emotive sculptures in bronze, the internationally acclaimed sculptor and artist, Rowan Gillespie, has just been commissioned to create a very special project: a set of sculptures for Hobart's waterfront in Tasmania, depicting and honouring the untold story of the Irish female convicts and their children who came to Hobart Town from Ireland. From 1803 to 1853, almost 13,000 convict women, together with more than 2000 children, arrived in Van Diemen's Land, with countless more perishing during the long and arduous sea journey from Ireland to Tasmania. In this fascinating documentary, the cameras will follow Gillespie as he visits Hobart to begin his research and immerse himself in the details of the project. During his time there he will visit the brutal sites these women would have found themselves in after arrival, such as the Sarah Island penal station in Macquarie Harbour and the Cascades Female Factory, a bleak workhouse for the newly arrived female convicts.(n)

Our first leg is the 548km Dovre line running from Oslo to the remote northern wonderland of Trondheim. Narrated by Bill Nighy.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: On this grand tour, Paul explores the upper reaches of the River Spey - Scotland's third-longest river - from its source in the wilds of Badenoch to Broomhill, halfway down the river. He hears stories of clan chief Cluny Macpherson, who hid with his gold for nine years in an inaccessible cave. Heading to a hidden tributary, Paul discovers a secret aristocratic Victorian love nest located in a remote glen where the wilderness is returning. In Newtonmore, Paul sees traditional Highland houses that remind him of Hobbit dwellings, before he rides a steam train on a heritage railway that follows the River Spey.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Starting a mile above sea level, in Colorado's state capital, Denver, our train, the Rocky Mountaineer, makes its way through Wild West country to Moab, in the state of Utah. On the way, we mine for gold, just as the first 'fifty-niners' did in the mid-19th century. At almost 12,000 feet, we ski the continental divide, where any water falling to the west heads to the Pacific and any to the east, the Atlantic. Entering the red rocks of the true Wild West, we pay homage at the grave of Doc Holliday - the dentist turned gunslinger. At the once-thriving town of Cisco, we meet one of the last four residents, whose town died when the railroad switched to diesel and the trains no longer stopped for water. Just before our train gets to Moab, we go in the water ourselves to whitewater raft down the mighty Colorado River.(n)

programme.title: Costco: Is it Really Worth It?
programme.desc: A look at the workings of the membership-only retailer, examining if its own-brand products are really premium ones in disguise, and putting them to the test. The program also explores the history of Costco, looks at the ways it gets its customers to spend, and reveals how the business manages to keep prices so low. Going behind the scenes of one of the most secretive retailers in Britain, we reveal the inside track to becoming a member of the exclusive Costco shopping club.(n)

programme.title: War of the Worlds

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Little Heroes
programme.desc: Paul meets 12-year-old, dog-loving Amelie, who's been coming to GOSH since she was a baby with a very rare case of juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA). Amelie struggles to walk far and has regular physiotherapy and medication to keep her mobile. Her ankle has become so bad that she has to have specialist surgery just to control the pain. Paul has a bit of a soft spot for this little trooper, not least because Amelie's named her dog Buster after his.(n)

programme.title: Engineering Reborn
programme.desc: An old deserted dry dock is transformed into an astonishing new subterranean museum. To build it, engineers had to drain the entire ground around it and rebuild a new concrete base and wall. This had to be anchored deep into the rock by long piles driven over 40 metres down. The result is an atmospheric and extraordinary new museum.(n)

programme.title: Inside Central Station
programme.desc: Back at Central, we meet Nasser, a customer service attendant at Central Station. Nasser is first on the scene when a woman faints onto another person standing on the platform and they both fall onto the side of an incoming train. It doesn't get any closer to disaster. Emergency procedures swing into action.(n)

programme.title: Autun: Rome's Forgotten Sister
programme.desc: With its 12,000 intramural inhabitants, today Autun is a small Saone et Loire town in the Bourgogne-Franche-Comte region, but a little less than 2000 years ago, it was the second-largest city in Gaul after Reims. It was then called Augustodunum, the 'Fortress of Augustus,' named after the most illustrious of Roman emperors. It extended over 200 hectares, twice as much as Lutetia (now Paris) and four times more than Massilia (Marseille). As the oldest centre of Christianisation in Gaul, its influence was both economic and intellectual, thanks to its unique Menian schools, a unique feature in that part of the empire that foreshadowed modern universities. How was this huge capital built in just a few decades? What technical challenges accompanied this monumental urban planning project? And what do the latest archaeological discoveries tell us about the role of this unique city in Gaul? All of these exclusive discoveries allow us to reveal a Roman Gaul much more refined than one could ever imagine.(n)

programme.title: Kensington Palace: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Explainer Rob Brand opens up the palace and briefs the team before the visitors arrive, and we find out about Kensington Palace's most famous resident, Princess Diana, who moved here with Prince Charles in 1981. Diana's dresses still draw huge crowds. programme.title: Thatcher & Reagan
programme.desc: The 'special relationship' between the UK and the US has weathered many global crises and personality clashes over the decades, but it arguably reached its zenith in the 1980s, when Thatcher and Reagan forged a unique friendship that grounded their political strategising in mutual respect. Thatcher's biographer, Charles Moore, who was The Telegraph's political correspondent throughout the era, traces their relationship through a turbulent decade of global political upheaval reshaped by UK and US efforts to thaw East/West relations and ultimately work towards tearing down the Iron Curtain.(n)

But they happened at a time when Australia was confronting its legacy of violence against Indigenous people.(n)
